intro: Ornithoboea wildeana, commonly known as the wildflower of the genus Ornithoboea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some regions for garden use.
